title: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Tender chicken pieces marinated in yogurt and spices, cooked in a rich, creamy tomato-based curry sauce. This classic Indian dish is perfect for a flavorful dinner.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, garam masala, and turmeric. Add chicken pieces and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat grill or oven to 220°C (425°F). Thread marinated chicken onto skewers and grill for 15-20 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through and slightly charred.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
Add tomato puree, cumin powder, paprika, and salt. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until the sauce thickens.
Reduce heat to low. Stir in heavy cream and butter. Add the grilled chicken pieces and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot with naan bread or basmati rice. Enjoy!

notes: For best results, marinate the chicken overnight for maximum flavor penetration.
You can substitute heavy cream with coconut cream for a dairy-free version that's just as delicious.
Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
The dish actually tastes better the next day as the flavors have more time to meld together.

faqs.question: Can I make this recipe ahead of time?
faqs.answer: Yes! This dish actually tastes better the next day as the flavors have more time to develop. Prepare it a day ahead and reheat gently before serving.

faqs.question: What can I serve with this dish?
faqs.answer: Chicken Tikka Masala pairs perfectly with basmati rice, naan bread, or roti. Add a side of cucumber raita to cool down the spices.

faqs.question: Can I freeze this recipe?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! This dish freezes well for up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator and reheat on the stovetop, adding a splash of cream if needed.

faqs.question: How can I adjust the spice level?
faqs.answer: To make it milder, reduce the amount of paprika and garam masala. For extra heat, add 1-2 chopped green chilies or a pinch of cayenne pepper.
